reference.title: Exporting a document in external format

section.p: You use the external format to distribute a translated document for checking, for example.

section.title: Calling sequence
section.p: To export a document in external format, select External Format from Export as.
The External Format page is displayed (see ). windowsExport Documents (External format) Export Documents window (External format)Figure shows Export Documents window (External format)

section.title: Options and parameters

plentry.pd: This box contains a list of the documents you selected in the Document List window.
Select this option to export the documents in their translated version.

Type the path name where you want the translated documents to be stored on the selected drive. Use a trailing backslash (\). You can also click Browse to display the Browse for Folder window on which you can select the appropriate path.

Select this option to have the parts of the exported document that have been newly translated marked. Revision marks can be individually defined by you. To specify a set of revision marks to be used, do one of the following:
Type the name of an existing set of revision marks or a new name.
Select an existing name from the list box.
To change an existing set of revision marks or to define new revision marks, click Editâ€¦. This takes you to the Edit Revision Marks window where you define your revision marks (see ).
Select this option to export the documents in their original version.

Type the path name on the selected drive where you want the original document to be stored. Use a trailing backslash (\). You can also click Browse to display the Browse for Folder window on which you can select the appropriate path.

You can select this option only if you selected Create file containing untranslated segments during analysis, which generates a file containing untranslated segments. Select this option if you want to export this file.
This exported file is in the format of an external with empty target segments. untranslated segmentsautomatic substitutionYou can transfer this file to a machine translation system to translate these segments automatically. machine translation systemThe machine translation system must first be programmed to recognize the source and target language segments in the external format of the .
After the empty target segments have been completed by the machine translation system, you can import the file into as a and use it to translate the rest of the document. The proposals offered in the window are then preceded by an [m] (generated by machine).

You must type the path name on the selected drive where you want the untranslated segments file to be stored. Use a trailing backslash (\). You can also click Browse to display the Browse for Folder window in which you can select the appropriate path.

section.p: Click Export to start document export.

section.title: Results
section.p: The document is exported in external format and stored as an HTML file in the directory under the file name you specified. The document can then be further processed with the corresponding word-processing system.
